field.name: help
field.p: Click to create a new order.
Use this menu to browse previous orders. To record new orders, you may use the menu Your Session for the touchscreen interface.

field.name: help
field.p: Click to add a new product.
You must define a product for everything you sell through the point of sale interface.
Do not forget to set the price and the point of sale category in which it should appear. If a product has no point of sale category, you can not sell it through the point of sale interface.

field.name: help
field.p: Click to define a new category.
Categories are used to browse your products through the touchscreen interface.
If you put a photo on the category, the layout of the touchscreen interface will automatically. We suggest not to put a photo on categories for small (1024x768) screens.

field.name: help
field.p: Click to add a payment method.

Payment methods are defined by accounting journals having the field PoS Payment Method checked. In order to be useable from the touchscreen interface, you must set the payment method on the Point of Sale configuration.

group.p: Barcode Patterns allow to match barcodes to actions or to embed information such as price and quantity in the barcode. Barcode Patterns only work with EAN13 barcodes.

Each type of barcode accepts a list of patterns seprated by commas. A scanned barcode will be attributed to a type if it matches one of its patterns. The patterns take the form of EAN13 barcodes. Numbers in the pattern must match the number in the scanned barcode. A 'x' or a '*' in a pattern will match any one number. If the patterns are shorter than EAN13 barcodes, they are assumed to be prefixes and match at the beginning. Weight, Price and Discount patterns also tell how the weight, price or discount is encoded in the barcode. 'N' indicate the positions where the integer part is en encoded, and 'D' where the decimals are encoded. If multiple pattern match one barcode, the longest pattern with the less 'x' or '*' is considered the matching one. If a barcode matches no pattern it will not be found in the POS.

div.p: You can define another list of available currencies on the Cash Registers tab of the payment method.

field.name: help
field.p: Click to start a new session.

A session is a period of time, usually one day, during which you sell through the point of sale. The user has to check the currencies in your cash registers at the beginning and the end of each session.
Note that you may use the menu Your Session to quickly open a new session.

form.p: Enter a reference, it will be converted automatically to a valid EAN number.
